Their MOTHERS, veiled in black, gather and talk. Bearded, turba MEN carrying AK-47's argue politics. A domestic, even tra scene of life in another part of the world...

51%. 'Abort' rec holds. THE DESERT: Now our guy DISAPPEARS into the crowd as they MOVING toward a large WOODEN PLANK on the desert floor. S the men take hold of the plank, drag it back to reveal... THE PENTAGON: SAME IMAGE in real-time on the feeds:
What is that, a weapons cache?

Sir, the placement of stones around the pit, markers for the Five Pillars of Islam... I think it's a funeral. Everyone trades looks -- this just got even more complica THE DESERT: from the back of a TENTED TRUCK, a BODY is li shrouded in white. The men carry it through blowing sand. procession stopping at the pit. They begin lowering the b THE PENTAGON: on monitors, a section of the GENEVA CONVEN
Sir, striking a funeral would put us in violation of the Geneva convention. 3/28/07 4.
Once this guy's gone, he's gone. The PENTAGON GENERAL COUNCIL pipes in --

"Hors de Combat" -- legally we'd be open to international prosecution. But we have no independent intel verifying it's in fact a funeral, and the presence of weapons certainly leaves room for interpretation.
I have POTUS calling from Air Force One.
(a beat, looks around). Everyone agree this is the best course of action? No one dissents. Callister picks up:

Mr. President, we have.a.51% identity match on Majid Al-Khoei. There is some possibility he's at a funeral, but we don't know. Regardless, counsel thinks we can claim 'Overriding Legal Authority.' Also, you should be aware we have an abort recommendation, but your cabinet, the Speaker, the Joint Chiefs urge a 'go.'
You left yourself out of the lineup. Callister pauses. AS THE MESSAGE ON THE MONITOR STARTS
Yessir... we gauge our strategy by two standards: the highest probability of success with the least amount of collateral damage. At 51% probability, we don't have either one.
And if it is Al-Khoei and he walks, Sir, we're putting our people at risk. There's a long silence as the President considers. 3/28/07 5.
I respect your caution, Geoff, but we won't get another chance like this... you have a green light. Callister's obviously opposed, but he bites his tongue:
Understood. (hangs up) We're weapons free. And with deadly calm, Techies execute orders into-headset
-- Switching to Tac-2, -- MTS active, painting the acquisition's good -- target --

The women begin to SING the "Nasheen," a.funeral song pra Allah. The beautiful VOICES grow until all other sound is DRONE POV: the feed from the CAMERA INSIDE THE NOSE-CONE LAUNCHES its missile -- it ZOOMS toward the funeral gathe The haunting, beautiful voices WAIL... in the moment befo impact, we see: birds flying across the great plain... a running gazelles... the DESERT WIND blankets a layer of s over the shrouded body in the pit... a CHILD'S HAND grasp mother's...

we need to get a new car --

you didn't know either?

when was the last time they saw him?

You sound just like him. Jerry's eyes find a point in space. This is love by proxy now he hugs, his father in support, not unity. William pu back. Takes his wallet from his pocket:

Jerry sits cuffed to a table. Frightened, confused, on th defensive. The door opens and AGENT THOMAS MORGAN enters: born to the job, never smiles. Takes a seat, opens a "fil
Look, man, I don't know what this is -- I don't know how all that shit got in my apartment, but unless you're my lawyer--
My condolences. I understand you've had a tough day.
it hasn't been ideal.
Your brother worked for the State Department. This was almost a question. And while it's obviously news us, Jerry clearly knew...
You tell me.
Were you close?
Why? What am I doing here. I don't even know who you are. Morgan tosses his black leather BADGE WALLET onto the met table. It lands open with a substantial CLUNG!
Tom Morgan, Special Agent attached to the National Counterterrorism Center.
(stares, rocked) Counterterrorism Center? You think I'm --

If you're asking if we were the kind of freaky twins you see at the mall wearing the same shirt, no. Listen, Paul traveled a lot, so we didn't -- 3/28/07 20.
Oh. That's right. He stamped visas in Karachi for a year. Then was a junior FSO in Beirut. Interesting places.
What're you... saying.
I'm just saying you didn't talk much. maybe you did.
Am I getting a lawyer here? 'Cause didn't hear my rights read to me--
You familiar with the slogan, "Declare War on War?"
what? No, why? Morgan pulls out a SURVEILLANCE PHOTO: Jerry, college-age STUDENT RALLY holding up a sign with an image of the Pent crossed out in red: "DECLARE WAR ON WAR!"
Because you painted it when you were part of the student activist group "Project Underground" at Berkley.

(stares-at pic; LAUGHS) Wait. Come on -- okay: her name was Julia, she was the smokinist girl I'd ever seen and she wanted me -- I would've gone to an "Anti-Oxygen" rally for her. I swear to God, dude--

You haven't been able to hold a job

-- what can I say? Guess I haven't found myself yet --

Or how about when I watched him being lowered into the ground -- that establish anything for you?! Somebody set me up! Morgan stares at him, unmoved. 3/28/07 22.
"Somebody." Who?
A woman, I don't know! She called me and told me I was gonna be arrested. GET

No more than Abdul Hamid, Taliban POW we caught in Afghanistan. Except his real name was Johnny Walker Lindh. Grew up in Marin County with a basketball hoop in his driveway and a carton of Tropicana in his fridge. He was blonder than you.. though. (RISES)
When I come back, you'd better tell me who you work for-- And heads out the door, SLAM! Jerry yells;
